summary: FAA sets and enforces safety standards for airlines, pilots, and others as a key means to achieve its mission—to provide the safest, most efficient aerospace system in the world. FAA changed how it enforces safety standards in 2015. Its new enforcement policy encourages use of training, counseling, and other compliance actions rather than civil penalties or enforcement actions to address violations. We found FAA has...
title: Aviation Safety: Actions Needed to Evaluate Changes to FAA's Enforcement Policy on Safety Standards
